1.title: It Starts...

11.content: Curse? Enchantment? Just plain lazy and gluttonous? These are canon-compliant options...with a chubby twist!
11.title: Canon-compliant?

113.content:
"When you're feeling bored or blue - watch out for the munchies! They find ways of making you munch when you're not hungry. Here, munch this. Here, munch that! Soon you're not just bored...you're fat!"

So...who gets a visit from the Munchies?
113.title: The Munchies?

choices: Give into the hunger, go eat breakfast
1131.content:
Beacon Hills had been surprisingly quiet on the supernatural front for months. As Derek’s only real job was patrolling and fighting off the usual forces of evil sent to destroy Beacon Hills, it had left him with very little to do. Exercising all day had become increasingly redundant, so his workouts were now limited to maybe an hour. If he felt like it. The pack had been slowly talking him into adding more and more furniture – he now had an almost fully-furnished house, complete with the biggest flat-screen TV they could find. It seemed like an unnecessary expense at the time, but now that Stiles and Scott had gotten him into terrible reality television shows, Derek appreciated the big screen. So much easier to get hooked into the drama that way.

Derek was currently on the seventh season of his Survivor binge, when his stomach started growling. Getting to his feet, he headed into the kitchen for something to eat. Unsurprisingly, the fridge and cabinets were empty, save for a few boxes of a cereal, a couple of apples, and some gelatinous milk. He felt no motivation to head to the grocery store, or even to call in a delivery order, so he sat back down on the couch, turning the TV back on and promising he would go out and get something for dinner instead.

As he settled down on the couch, an ad popped on the screen. A group of little gray blobs with smiling faces and wide eyes were clustered together, giggling.

You don’t look busy, so we felt it wouldn’t be rude
if we took a moment to intrude.
We’ve noticed you have nothing to eat,
So let the Munchies perform an amazing feat!

The screen shut off right after and refused to turn back on. Irritated, Derek got to his feet. Might as well go get food and hope the screen came back on. On his way to the door, he stopped. He was suddenly salivating with the sudden overwhelming aromas of food wafting out of his kitchen.

Following the scent, he found his entire kitchen bursting with various kinds of food. A pan of lasagna and loaves of garlic bread were cooking in the oven. The fridge was loaded with different cheeses, huge portions of ready-to-be-heated casseroles or macaroni, along with bakery boxes of cakes, pies, cheesecakes, and dessert bars. Even the cabinets had been refilled with chips and snacks.

The little gray blobs were sitting on his kitchen table.

Derek growled, backing up instinctively and grabbing for his phone, halfway through sending a text out to the pack.

“Get out.”

Awww why are you in such a bad mood?
Looks like someone needs some food!

“I’m not hungry.” Derek lied. He flushed when his belly started grumbling loudly again, followed by a sharp pang of hunger.

We promise that the munchies mean no harm,
really there is no cause for alarm.
We saw you were out of food, our friend,
so we’ve made you a feast that will never end!

Derek put the phone down on the counter, eying the meal cooking in the oven. A few bites wouldn't hurt, he didn't smell wolfsbane or any other poison, and he could easily squash these "Munchies" with a fist. Really, nothing felt threatening about these little creatures.

“You better leave after I eat,” he told them. He pulled the lasagna and bread out of the oven and took a seat at the table as the Munchies watched him gleefully, giggling to themselves.

Three of them jumped off the counter and then scurried back, presenting Derek with a fork.

Don’t worry about manners, why get a plate,
not eating it all would be mistake!

Derek took a hesitant bite. The sauce was rich and flavorful, the pasta smothered with layers and layers of cheeses. It tasted even better than it smelled. He started taking greedy forkfuls, setting a brisk pace, his mouth constantly chewing. Occasionally he would pause and tear off a chunk of bread, shoving it in his mouth before turning back to the pan of pasta.

Since we want to see your weight increase,
we’re throwing you a gigantic feast!
Food is always better with fat and grease!
How else will we make you grow so obese?

Their words made Derek pause and look up. He had eaten more than he thought - a loaf of garlic bread and over half of the lasagna, but didn’t feel nearly as full as he should have been after such carb heavy food. He pushed himself back from the table.

“I’m done eating.”

“Lies!” The Munchies cried.

What’s the harm in one day to cheat?
You deserve to have a treat!

He picked up the fork again and the Munchies cheered. Derek’s mind felt clouded by the overwhelming hunger he felt, but their logic did make sense. He had been working out the last few weeks, one day of indulgence wouldn’t do any harm. These…creatures likely didn’t know he was a werewolf. All this food wouldn’t affect him as much as a human, he could easily burn it off in a few workouts. With renewed gusto, he finished the lasagna and garlic bread. Before he could take a pause from his last bite, the Munchies had brought Derek over more food.

“Hold on.” He struggled to his feet. His stomach was rounded, pressing uncomfortably tight against the waistband of his pants. “I need something to drink.”

“Sit! Sit!” The Munchies demanded. “We’ll take care of it!”

A gallon of milk appeared by his side. Derek immediately brought it to his lips, taking a few, long chugs, before he set it back down. He leaned back in his seat, reaching underneath his swollen gut to undo the button of his pants. Despite the huge meal he had just eaten, the hunger pains still hit him. He was desperate for more, all the food spread out in front of him on the table looked luring him in.

We know you can handle so much more,
eat until your belly’s sore,
you can stop when you don't fit through your door!

Derek reached out for the next dish in front of him, a plate piled high with lemon bars. Once he had finished that he moved on to the bowl of macaroni and cheese. He started eating more greedily as he went, shoveling food into his mouth to try and satisfy his ever-growing hunger, one hand rubbing his bloating stomach.

He lost track of time and how many dishes he had consumed. It seemed for each one he finished, two more were brought in his place. Finally, his belly was at the point of being painfully full, sitting in his lap, hugely inflated with food. His shirt had risen up, barely stretching over the top of his gut.

“That’s it. I – urp – no more.”

He tried to get to his feet, panting and burping as the weight of his tummy kept him solidly in the chair. Derek shifted into a more comfortable position, deciding he would sit there and digest first before he started moving…

He drifted off to sleep.

***

He woke up on the couch, the television still running. Sleepily, Derek reached for the remote and turned it off, before lazily sitting up on the couch. He faintly remembers having the most bizarre dream, only to look up and see the gray blobs from his dream watching him.

Frowning, Derek made up his mind to:
1131.title: Derek

11311.content:
With the hunger gone from his mind, he could suddenly think clearer. Whatever enchantment or curse or spell the Munchies had put on him had worn off. It had left its mark, however. Derek’s abs were completely gone, covered by a sizable potbelly. Even his chest had gotten softer, and his lovehandles were spilling over the waistband of his still unbuttoned jeans.

Derek heaved himself to his feet. He swayed slightly, unused to having weight around his middle. He fumbled for the button of his pants, trying and failing to even get the two sides of them close enough to fasten with his belly spilling in-between. Giving up, he pulled his shirt to try and cover it. It barely reached the bottom of his belly and was clinging tightly to his new flab.

Hehe all that bread and pasta and sugary sweets put you in a trance.
After eating all that there’s simply no chance
you’ll ever be able to button those pants.

“What did you do to me?” Derek growled.

You have to admit it was great
eating until your cleared the plates!

Derek had his claws out and with one swipe, sliced through the group of blobs on his kitchen table. They shrieked and then went silent, oozing together into one big mess that sizzled and seemed to evaporate. Satisfied they were gone for good, Derek looked around for his cell phone.

Awww come on, take a seat,
sure we can’t tempt you into one more treat?”

The Munchies were back on the table, still smiling at Derek. He refused to even look at them.

“I ate plenty last night. I’m not eating more.”



Come on, Derek, you can’t beat us
why are you trying to make such a fuss?

A group of them brought a chocolate cake over and set it on the table. It was Derek’s weakness. Rich, moist cake, three layers high, covered with chocolate ganache, and so big it obscured the plate it was resting on.


His stomach was rumbling. Derek determinedly kept looking for his phone, trying to ignore the cravings for more food. It was no use. The smell of the chocolate was so strong, he may as well have been bathing in it.

“Once slice,” he told them, fangs dropping and eyes flashing. The Munchies looked unperturbed by the threat.

Derek used his fingers to take a small piece of the cake, planning to only try a little. The small bite was it took. The hunger came back will full force and suddenly he couldn’t get enough of it. He started taking gluttonous handfuls, cramming as much of it in his mouth as he could.

The Munchies watched him eat, gleeful.

Big, bad Alpha thinks he’s tough?
He can't fight when he’s stuffed.
All the food in his belly will be rough
its sure to make him huff and puff.


Derek barely heard them. He was moaning with pleasure, each bite of the cake better than the last. It was gone before he knew it. Panting, Derek looked down at his belly which was distended and bulging, jutting out a few more inches to sit further on his thighs. He felt heavy, bigger than he had ever been his life. Briefly, he wondered how much further he could take this. How much more these little things would feed him, how much more he could possibly eat, how fat he would get before he finally had enough.


Thirsty once more, Derek braced himself on the table and pushed himself to his feet. He shuffled over to the fridge, one hand cradling his belly. He bent down, soft gut hanging out the bottom of his shirt. There was no way he should be this ravenous, but his stomach still felt empty.

To cheers from the Munchies, Derek pulled a two-liter bottle of soda from the fridge and started to frantically guzzle it down, hoping something would finally fill him.

“I..need..more,” he gasped, taking a few seconds before returning to gulping down the soda.

All that soda down your throat
look at how your belly bloats


Derek tossed the bottle aside when he was done. “Urp. I’m so – urp – hungry.” His gut was becoming almost comically spherical, too full to do anything but stick out, perfectly round and expanding wider and wider as it was filled.

He started going through cabinets. A box of Twinkies. Three packages of cookies. Chips. Poptarts. Everything Derek could quickly tear open and shove into his mouth.

Look at you, we’re very proud,
you've eaten 'till your almost round.

Too full and overstuffed to stand any longer, Derek sank back on the couch, both hands rubbing his massively engorged belly. He was not as opposed to the feeling as he thought. It was a satisfying fullness and he felt almost pride at how enormously fat he felt. I can do better, he thought. I’m the Alpha. I should be bigger…

His thoughts were interrupted by his phone ringing from somewhere in the house.

Since this meal will never end
maybe you should share it with a friend…


They tossed his phone to him on the ground.

You’re going to be here for the long haul,
so we’ll let you have this one phone call!


Derek reached for his phone to see who was calling him....
11311.title: Try and fight them

11312.content:
Derek groggily made his way to the kitchen, once again feeling ravenous, following the wafting smell of bacon. The sun was rising, usually signifying it was time for his morning run. Any motivation, however small, to go running was completely gone when Derek saw the massive spread of breakfast sitting on his table. Scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles and pancakes smothered in butter and syrup and whipped cream…so many portions of food sat in front of him, enough to serve a large pack of hungry werewolves.

He wouldn’t wait to start eating. Derek was at least 90% sure he was still asleep and dreaming. Considering how miserable most of his dreams were, he would gladly take this one. That was the only logic explanation. His pants were still undone. Derek tried to fasten them, his gut no longer bloated, but last night’s feast had settled into a layer of fat around his waist and belly, sticking out over his waistband and refusing to allow his pants to button.

Derek gave up with a shrug. It was his dream, who really cared? He tugged his shirt down over the curve of his belly and took a seat at the table, greeted by the Munchies’ giggling as they started pushing dishes towards him. If it was a dream, he was going to make the most of it.

We hated to wake you from your slumber,
but you need to pack on much more blubber!

Derek grabbed the plate of bacon, eagerly digging in. The last time he had eaten a proper, full breakfast like this had not been in over a decade, not since the fire had he eaten so well. He almost felt bad, if this wasn’t a dream, for not inviting the others. But then again, he was the Alpha. Scott and Jackson’s strength was increasing, Derek would have to work hard to maintain his status as the biggest and strongest.

Eat up, hurry, don’t delay
we need you stuffed through day.

Time seemed to pass away as Derek ate. The Munchies watched in delight as the Alpha started to fatten before them, consumed by his gluttony. Fistfuls of bacon. Once the plate was finished, Derek paused only long enough to wipe the grease off his hands before he reached for another plate. Scrambled eggs, piled high with bags of shredded cheese. Derek’s gut was bulging into his lap, werewolf healing frantically trying to catch up with his consumption Chocolate filled croissants. Bagels slathered with cream cheese. His shirt was riding up the increasing curve, resting right below his belly button. More bacon. An entire ham, which the Munchies considerately sliced for him as he gobbled it down. Derek pulled his shirt down, struggling to stretch it over his belly, which was resting heavily in his lap. A seam split down the side.

Since you think it’s just a dream,
why not go the extreme?
Here - guzzle down this heavy cream!

Derek took the challenge. He reached down the table, struggling with the weight of his tummy blocking his way, and pulled the waffle towards him. Between bites, he stopped to chug down a glass of the thick cream. Towards the end of the waffles, his pace started to slow. He was, taking smaller bites and breathing heavily as he leaned back in his chair. His stomach had reached almost full capacity, rounded out so wide Derek couldn’t wrap his arms around it, instead trying to relieve the pressure by rubbing the sides of it.

You can’t stop now, you’re so very near
to having eaten this whole table clear!

Derek groaned in response. “In a bit.”

Aren’t you the Alpha? Big and bad,
the amount you’ve eaten is rather sad
We know you can handle so much more
after all, you belly hasn’t touched the floor!

“This is big enough.” He pats his gut, stuffed so solid it didn’t wobble. He let out a few small burps and went back to rubbing it. It felt good. Heavy. Derek lifted it up, feeling it’s weight, before belching and letting it fall back against his thighs. He knew it was only so heavy because of all the food he ate and couldn’t help but feel a little disappointed by tomorrow, he would only be left with a few extra pounds.

Even though your belly aches,
we insist you try a few pancakes

The pancakes were all that was left from Derek’s breakfast feast. The table was littered with crumbs and stacks of plates that Derek had polished off. He had come this far….

“Fine. That’s – uff- more than enough food for the day.” Derek leaned forward with a grunt. His belly came between him and the table, making it impossible to simply lean over and pull the food towards him. The Munchies brought the plate over to him balancing it on his belly, before reaching out with their tiny hands and starting to feed Derek chunk after chunk of the butter and syrup soaked pancakes.

It’s your reward for getting big,
we won’t make you do a thing!

Derek mindlessly chewed and swallowed, the plate of pancakes seemed never-ending and he started to lose focus, overwhelmed by his fullness and greed. Eventually, Derek nodded off, arms resting on top of his gut.


When he woke up, the Munchies suggested he:
11312.title: Give into the hunger, go eat breakfast

113122.content:
Get up, get dressed, and out you go,
we need more food so you can grow.

Derek sat up, his back protesting having slept for a few hours in a very uncomfortable chair. He got into the shower, quickly washing off before toweling off. Standing in his bedroom, and feeling more awake after the shower, Derek spend a good ten minutes examining his widen figure, softened by at least thirty pounds. His belly had taken most of the weight, protruding out and spreading to the sides to form wide love handles, resting beneath his softening chest. Thicker thighs, a butt that was threatening to jiggle as he walked, and the hint of a double chin.

None of his jeans fit. Derek had tried every size in his closet. The tightest ones barely pulled up his thighs and the ones that he did wiggle up further wouldn’t stretch over his generous rear. Looking at the pile on the ground, Derek picked back up the largest, most flexible pair he had. Only by laying on his bed, sucking in his gut, was he able to fasten the pants. The waistband cut painfully into his stomach and made his hips look even fleshier as they spilled over the sides.

The shirt situation was no better. Even the largest Henley Derek had clung to him like a second skin, highlighting his moobs and belly. The tightness of the clothes only served to truly show off his growth and make Derek look even fatter, his fat squeezed and bulging out of his outfit. There was no way he could go out like this and the idea of walking into town held no appeal for him.

Not to worry, pretend it’s a dream,
no one will notice when you bursting at the seams.

“I can order lunch.”

We brought five foot longs from the deli,
but we know that's not enough to fill your belly.

It was a much more appealing solution than going out. Derek happily settled himself on the couch next to five feet of meatball subs. He happily gorged, grunting and groaning as he his swelling belly pressed up against his already too-tight waistband. After the third sub, the button on his pants gave up the fight and burst off. The Munchies cheered. Derek put a hand on his belly, massaging the red marks, but kept eating. Once all the sandwiches were gone, he sat back like a sated, full predator.

Don’t let that hold you back
those sandwiches were just a snack.
Come on, come on, we have to go
give the town such a show
watching you eat and eat and grow!


Derek decided to go:
113122.title: Go out to eat

1132.content:
Jackson came back from the gym to find a bakery box sitting at his doorway. Frowning, he bent down to check name and address on it. It was his name and his address.

“Idiots.” Jackson muttered. “I didn’t order this.”

He looked around, checking to see if any of the neighbors were watching. There was no way he was going to let anyone think that Jackson Whitmore cheated on his diet and workout regime. Satisfied no one would see him, he brought the box inside. There was a note written on the top of it.

We know you’re always at the gym,
working hard at staying slim.
So have on us a little treat,
there’s plenty more you need to eat!

It was more than a little suspicious. Jackson opened it, standing as far away as he could. It was an innocent, unassuming chocolate silk pie. There was a second note inside:

Dig in, enjoy, and eat away,
you deserve a few cheat days!

Jackson preened a little bit. This must be a gift from someone at the gym. He did work extremely hard to maintain his figure. It was about time someone noticed and they weren’t wrong – he did deserve to have a cheat day. He couldn’t remember the last time he had one.

He took a quick shower, toweling off and pulling on some designer jeans and a button-down shirt before heading into the kitchen. He took the box with the pie, a plate, knife, and a fork to the living room and settled himself down in front of the television. Jackson cut himself a slice and started mindlessly eating as he flipped through a couple of shows.

Jackson had very high standards of food. Having grown up with only the best and finest gourmet cuisine, and the money to sustain the habit, Jackson plainly refused to eat anything less than quality. Whatever bakery the pie was from, those chefs knew quality food. Jackson cut himself a second slice. And then a third.

He was so busy moaning softly, his eyes fluttering with each rich, chocolatey bite; he failed to notice the little gray blobs watching him. When Jackson reached for another piece, cursing under his breath when he found the tin empty, the creatures started cackling.

We are sure you have your doubts,
but we saw you pigging out.
Now the Munchies are here, not a moment too soon
so they can help you really balloon!

Jackson tried to leap to his feet. Instead, he belched and fell back into the couch. Just bloated he told himself, trying to ignore the way his toned stomach had puffed out to form a full, swollen gut.

“I don’t know what the hell you are, but I’m allowed a cheat day,” Jackson told them snippily.

One cheat day turns into seven,
and then you’ll be in a food-filled heaven.

“Um, no. One cheat day means just that. One. I have a figure to maintain.”

Go ahead and scoff,
if you really think you can work it off,
the Munchies will be very nice
and offer you another slice!

A few of the blobs crawled over with another pie.

“Is that a challenge?” Jackson snarled. The creatures only cackled.

“Fine.” He reached for the pie tin, setting it down on the space on his lap his belly did not take up, and grabbing the fork. “Why not? It is my cheat day. I’ll go the gym tomorrow and burn all this off.”

Sadly, we just don’t agree,
and very soon you’ll come to see
that life is better when gluttony is set free.

“I’m not letting myself go and I certainly will never get fat.” It was a less credible statement considering he was shoveling pie in his mouth as his tummy slowly rounded out. Jackson surprised himself by how quickly he finished it. Two pies in and he barely felt any more satisfied or full than he was after the first one.

“Happy?” Jackson huffed. “I finished it. Now leave me alone.”

Only two? That’s rather small,
here we thought you could eat them all!

The couch next to Jackson was suddenly filled with boxes of various pies. His mouth started watering with the different scents that started wafting towards him.

“I had enough.”

Then why don’t you take a break?
We’ve brought you plenty of protein shakes.

The Munchies pushed a jug of thick cream over to him, along with a filled glass. Jackson guzzled it down, then greedily grabbed at the jug and poured himself more. He sat back, bringing up a fist to stifle a belch.

“Fine. One – urp – more. That’s all.”

He leaned forward to cut himself a slice of the third pie. The button on his pants flew off, clattering against the tile floor. His gut surged forward, resting against his thighs. The Munchies started giggling.

“They were cheap pants. I knew I should stick to Armani.”

Once you finish all those pies,
they won’t make clothes to fit your size!

Jackson rolled his eyes. “I have a personal tailor.”

He continued plowing through the pies. The third pie slowly turned into his fourth, and then his fifth. The buttons on his shirts were desperately clinging on, huge gaps were visible between them as Jackson’s belly kept widening.

“Who makes these? Not very – ooof – filling.” he struggled to sit up on the couch, rocking back and forth to try to get the momentum to move. As his jelly jiggled with the movement, the buttons on his shirt gave up, flying off across the room. He gave up, resting the remaining pie on his swollen gut, which was so heavily stuffed it made a perfect shelf. Jackson finally felt like he was getting full, but there were only three pies left. Those stupid creatures had challenged him to finish them and he refused to be beaten by some stupid little balls of grease.

Another piece, are you sure that's wise?
Look at the size of your belly and thighs.

Jackson stubbornly kept eating, one hand having migrated to his belly, massaging it as he ate. “I told you,” he panted. “ – I can eat anything I want on an – urp – cheat day.”

Every bite was now followed by a moan or burp as he kept forcing more pie in his belly. His stomach was forcing to lean progressively further back against his seat, grunting and breathing heavily as he reached for more. When he had finished that one, he managed to swing his legs up so he was laying on his back. He wrapped his arms around his enormous belly, planning on sleeping off the massive bloat.

Way to go! You’ve finished eight!
It’s made quite an impact to your weight!

There was a sudden knock at his door. The Munchies eyes lit up.

“Ignore it.” Jackson muttered. “No one is seeing me like this.”

We wonder who is at your door
Maybe they’ve heard you’re greedy for more!
They want to see the greedy slob
who’s made eating his new job!

The Munchies all jumped on top of his gut, jostling Jackson’s poor, swollen belly. He belched, loud enough for the person at his door to hear.

“Jackson?”

“Come in!” The Munchies cried.

Who entered the room?
1132.title: Jackson

114.content: Overeating over the holidays to supernatural holiday curses, any excuse to overeat!
114.title: Holiday Weight?

1141.content:
“Why are we hunting Santa?” Scott whispered to Stiles. He may as well have shouted the question - whispering around wolves was futile.

Jackson was a few paces in front of them, rolling his eyes without looking back. “Don’t tell me you still believe in Santa.”

Stiles scoffed, which finally made Jackson stop walking and look around. “Dude, werewolves. Witches. Banshees. Why not Santa?”

“It’s a Krampus,” Derek interjected.

“Disguised as Santa,” Isaac clarified.

“Who may, or may not, actually be Santa.”

“Scott, there is no Santa.” Derek growled. “It’s disguising itself as Santa to trick little kids.”

“We know this thing isn’t Santa, but there could still be an actual, real Santa.”

“It isChristmas Eve.”

Jackson was grumbling. “Next time, I vote we leave McCall and Stilinski behind.”

“Fine by me.” Stiles said. They had been walking around in the cold for a few hours now, patrolling different neighborhoods for any signs of the intruder. The Christmas trickster had been sneaking into houses in the middle of the night and kidnapping children, planning to sacrifice them as a Christmas ritual. The pack had discovered the terrified children in the woods, trapped in a cave and returned them to their families. This was the last night for the creature to collect enough children from the ceremony and the last chance the pack had to eliminate it before it went into hibernation for another year.

They had seen nothing so far and as Christmas Eve’s went, this had to be one of the worst. Another forty-five minutes went by before Derek held up a hand, eyes flashing red as he gestured to the roof of a nearby house.

Santa – the Krampus – was on top of the roof. He looked like an ordinary human to Stiles. Wide-figure, white hair and, although his back was turned to them, Stiles could only imagine a white beard to match, black boots, red pants and jacket with a thick, black belt…he definitely seemed more like Santa Claus then a monster here to kidnap children.

“So…who wants to go on the roof and kill Santa?”
1141.title: Christmas

choices: Just a business card (he really was Santa)
11411.content:
"What if a kid is watching us?" Scott hissed. "We can't let them see us murder Santa."

"Fine. I'll do it," Derek told him. "The rest of you spread out, he might make a run for it."

With a snarl, Derek shifted to his beta form, leaping on the roof. Before he even got near the figure, there was a startled scream, and the Santa tripped, hitting his head against the chimney before falling to the ground.

Derek quickly jumped down as the other wolves and Stiles ran over. The body had vanished, leaving nothing but the pants, boots, and jacket.

"So...is that it? You startled him into dying?" Stiles clapped Derek on the back. "Good job guys, let's go home and sleep."

"You really think it was that easy?" Jackson asked.

Derek nodded tersely in agreement, bending down to examine the abandoned clothes. He found a small envelope in the pocket of the pants and pulled it open.
11411.title: Derek
