choices: Weight gain camps are normal, they know what they're in for!
Something goes wrong on a trip to regular lacrosse camp...
131.content:
First, the context of this scenario:

Is this a universe where weight gain camps are normal, or is it a trip to a regular sports camp gone supernaturally wrong?
131.title: Weight Gain Camp

choices: Semi-realistic gain speed over a much longer time
1312.content:
(Disclaimer: I'm not athletic and have definitely never actually been to a sports camp, so I'm gonna be taking a lot of liberties... but to be fair, this isn't a real sports camp anyway. Also, this is an AU, so a good chunk of canon stuff is disregarded or changed as needed.)

The Beacon Hills lacrosse team was on a long bus ride to what was supposed to be a week-long training camp for lacrosse... The place was pretty well out of the way, nestled in a well-forested area, so no one was particularly suspicious when they didn't recognize where they were going as the bus twisted and turned along a road lined with almost nothing but what seemed like an endless amount of trees...

But when the bus suddenly broke down after an hour of uneventful driving, that was when they realized something a bit odd was going on. Not only had there been absolutely no prior indication that anything was wrong with the bus at all, but they realized that the bus had somehow stopped only meters away from what seemed like the wide, dirt-path entrance to a lacrosse camp...

Everyone was pretty sure there was something slightly off. It didn't have the name it was supposed to, instead there was simply a huge sign reading "Camp XXXL: Bring Out Your Fullest Potential"

Still, something told them to at least go in and try seeing for themselves what was going on, so they all filed off the bus with their bags and things and headed into the entrance.

Some boys, especially the werewolves, started to feel slightly strange at the entrance, but not necessarily in a bad way. It was more like a brief moment of vertigo and brain-fog that quickly vanished, giving way to feelings that were actually rather pleasant. If anything, they suddenly felt like the place was somehow comfortingly familiar, even though they had never been there before. It was a feeling somewhat like nostalgia... not to mention how they could all suddenly smell some faint but absolutely delicious aromas wafting through the air, even the players who weren't werewolves.

Some boys began to salivate a bit, suddenly hungry. Both the hunger and familiar, comforting feeling worked to start rapidly pushing away any doubts they had, replacing them with attempts to defend the place instead. Maybe they just remembered the name wrong, or there was a miscommunication. Maybe they just made a mistake with the GPS. Maybe the bus did already have something wrong with it, it's not like it was an exceptionally new or fancy bus anyway.

A very attractive, curvy, blonde woman came out to meet them in figure-hugging jeans and a "Camp XXXL" t-shirt. "Welcome to Camp XXXL, everybody! I'm the head supervisor here! Sorry if this isn't quite what you were expecting, there must have been a couple of mistakes in setting things up... But I promise, you've all been accounted for, and we already have everything ready for you, so don't you worry!" Her voice and appearance immediately had an unusually powerful calming and charming effect on the boys, even the ones who didn't prefer girls. Outside of just sex appeal, she had an aura like a trusted big sister, or a very charismatic hostess of some sort. It was actually rather odd, but no one noticed. Even as she gave an odd grin and her eyes briefly flashed with green light, no one really noticed.

As a handsome, beefy, black-haired man who looked to be in his early to mid-twenties walked up beside her, she spoke up again. "And this is Derek, a new advisor here! You'll be seeing a lot of him!" she said, prompting Stiles, Scott, Ethan, Aiden, Isaac, Jackson, Theo, and Liam to all ponder and quietly talk amongst themselves about their utter surprise that Derek had somehow started working at the camp too, not even sure how and why he was qualified to... But like most of the camp, they didn't really question it further.

Everyone was given a tour of the camp, the attractive woman chattering at a mile a minute as she showed them the lacrosse field, the gym, gave them their keys and room numbers for all the cabins, and showed them the buffet style cafeteria... which served to make everyone realize they were even hungrier than they already thought they were.

The place looked clean, well funded, and incredibly inviting, not to mention the heavenly smell. Rather than usual hard benches or normal chairs, all the seating in the cafeteria looked incredibly plush and comfy.

"I see you're all hungry! Well, we can't have that! We plan to keep you all very well fed here. There will be no restrictions on the cafeteria, and you can come eat whenever you want... You all look way too skinny, after all, so it's no wonder you're hungry." she said with a giggle. No one thought anything of it, since it seemed like a harmless joke. "And I bet you wanna get more muscles on you too! So this is your perfect chance to relax those diets and do a little bulking, if you want! To start with, everyone can head to the table over there, we've got ready-made subs to hold you over for the rest of the tour, and while we talk more about what exactly will be going on here," she explained, pointing to a long table off a bit behind her that did indeed have dozens of footlong subs stacked on it.

Even with the subs not being made to order, everyone somehow managed to easily find their favorite kinds on the table... Of course, they were all high-calorie and generous with fatty toppings, but they were all so spectacularly delicious that no one cared. As the tour continued, everyone dug into their subs, and found themselves finishing faster than they even realized. Were they all really that hungry?

Before anyone could question it too much, Derek was already passing out more subs, and absolutely no one turned down seconds. Pretty much everyone devoured them just as rapidly as the first, and as soon as they were starting to realize that they were pretty thirsty after the subs, Derek was also handing out big 32 oz bottles of soda... With none of them being diet soda.

Even though everyone knew on some level that athletes should avoid soda, those concerns were forgotten as they all drank it like their lives depended on it, leaving their stomachs gassy and even more bloated... But several boys even wanted thirds on the subs, including nearly all the werewolf boys except for Jackson, who was the most accustomed to eating right and had at least a little more self control, but not enough to realize anything particularly odd was happening.





By time the tour and questioning periods concluded, and everyone was settling into their cabins, all of them were already completely full, if not outright stuffed. They'd been told it was okay to just relax for a while, and nap for a bit if they wanted, so many of them were preparing to do just that. Still, it didn't go unnoticed that their cabins seemed to be just as high-budget as the cafeteria, and very cozy and relaxing. Even though they were assigned three people to a cabin, they didn't feel crowded at all. They even had their own fridges and cabinets, already stocked with lots of appealing snacks, protein bars, and surprisingly high-end looking protein and weight gain powders.

"Do you get the weird feeling that this place might be a lot better than we expected?" Stiles said to Scott and Isaac as he laid down, since he'd been assigned to room with them. He was so stuffed and comfortable that he wasn't even the slightest bit suspicious, so he fully meant what he was saying.

"Definitely" Isaac said with a smile, settling into his bed as well.

"Yeah, this place seems like heaven so far," Scott replied from his own bed, before he suddenly unwrapped and took a big bite of what looked like a protein bar from the cabinets.

"...Dude, you're still eating? I saw you ask for a third sub!" Stiles said.

"...Yeah, so? I am pretty full already, but the food here is amazing! This is literally the best protein bar I've ever had," Scott said. He hadn't paid attention to the nutrition facts, which would've also told him it was 750 calories, weirdly high for a protein bar... although it did actually have more protein than usual too.

"Pfft. You're gonna blow up like a balloon if you're not careful." Isaac joked, although he secretly wasn't exactly opposed to the idea of Scott putting on a few.

"Oh come on, it's only gonna be a week. Besides, I think that lady was right about the bulking thing. I think I'd be happy adding about 20 or 25 pounds of muscle, especially if I want to look more like an Alpha" Scott said, not realizing that he was in for much more than '20 or 25 pounds', and not just muscle.





Meanwhile, the head supervisor was in her own room, plotting the course of how the remainder of camp would go as she held up a cupped palm with perfectly manicured nails, and a ball of bright green magical power materialized in it. After all, she was a witch, not just a supervisor. She wanted the boys huge, not amazing at lacrosse.

Although everyone's appetite, metabolism, and general body chemistry had already been mildly altered just by arriving, it still wasn't all that far outside of normal. She surmised that everyone could eat a rough average of two times more than they could before, and their metabolisms were about 30% slower, but everything varied quite a bit between each individual boy. But as she cast the next spell, she knew it would have far more potential...

It could be powerful weight gain magic that would have far more potent effects on the biology and mental state of everyone present, allowing them to eat and gain at completely impossible rates for just a one week stay...

Or it could be potent time magic, greatly prolonging their stay while the outside world remained blissfully unaware, and also keeping the slight enchantments on their appetites and bodies intact.

Perhaps it could even be a mixture of the two, or something else entirely...

So, what is it then?
1312.title: Strange Detour...

13122.content:
With a snap of her fingers, the witch sent out a blast of magical energy that raced outwards like a great dome, expanding to fill the whole camp. It started off bright green when it first escaped her fingers, but rapidly faded to become totally invisible. It stopped right around the perimeter of the camp, creating a special barrier that ignored matter, but twisted how time worked.

Now, with the spell in place, time in the outside world would continue at the same speed, so that the boys communicating with anyone outside of the barrier wouldn't cause any strange instabilities or paradoxes, but the outside world was now in a time loop. The week where all the boys were supposed to be in lacrosse practice would happen over and over again, without anyone thinking anything strange was going on.

Meanwhile, inside the bubble, there was no time loop. Everyone would experience time as normal, but since the outside world was looping, the seasons still wouldn't change. Although the witch was certain they would still be perceptive enough to eventually realize that time had changed somehow, she wasn't too worried about them actually doing much about it.

The enchantment on the camp was designed to make everything feel more like a good dream than actual reality, making everyone increasingly unlikely to question or worry about anything, and lower their inhibitions and suspicions. The effect would be more than strong enough to keep them complacent by time the first week was up. Not even most supernaturals were resistant. Eventually, it'd get to a point where she could openly admit her true powers and identity if she wanted to, and no one would even mind.

But with the time spell successfully set up, the witch could relax for a while, and just watch her plans unfold.

So what boys will we be focusing on the most right now? (Note that this can of course be changed freely as things progress, and it's merely about who's at the forefront, not literally restricting things to only those boys)
13122.title: Semi-realistic gain speed over a much longer time

choices: Wants Scott to help him gain quicker
Admits he has a crush on Scott
131221.content:
After everyone's nap, most of the boys decided to hit the gym, some of them still feeling a twinge of guilt over how their first meal hadn't been particularly healthy or restrained.

Scott wasn't one of the guilty ones, even though he ate one of the largest amounts. But some, like Theo and Jackson, were really feeling the guilt and bewilderment at what'd come over them.

Just like the cabins and cafeteria, the gym also looked high-budget and very welcoming, despite the witch's actual goals.

The witch was still providing a functioning, effective camp gym due to certain rules of her magic... Namely, that it was much easier to keep people under her spell when they were happy and not too stressed... and she could heavily influence the boys and reduce their inhibitions, but she couldn't change their minds about things too suddenly or forcefully, or fully mind control them. There had to be at least some kind of willingness to cooperate, even if it was buried deep down inside.

Therefore, it was in the witch's best interest to still let everyone exercise. She'd even made it faster and easier for them to gain muscle, just like she'd made it easier to eat and put on fat. Muscle tended to come on much more slowly, but with the rate boosted, they would be able to gain muscle much faster, although still only at about 1/3rd the speed of fat. Muscle would also help them counteract the downsides of their weight gain, and knowing they were getting stronger would make them both more willing to gain and more willing to trust her. She didn't really worry that anyone could exercise enough to keep themselves from gaining, since they'd be too hungry and lacking in self-control to manage that. Just to be sure about that, the exercise equipment was also enchanted to push their appetites a little bit further and cause a small increase in post-workout hunger, further ensuring they would never burn more than they were taking in.

And of course, to be extra sure she got her way, there was always a simple but relatively effective tactic... Misinformation.

As boys worked out, she'd come by and give them half-true or at least seemingly clever advice, which was made easier by how they were already more trusting and gullible from her magic.

At one point, she leaned down next to Scott as he lifted and spoke encouragingly. "Keep yourself full of high-calorie foods whenever you're building muscle. Don't limit anything. Muscle takes a lot of energy to make and maintain, so your body limits the speed it can grow for safety. If you keep eating and staying full, your body stops thinking it needs to limit the speed, so you gain muscle much easier that way, even if you don't eat very healthily."

As an ever-so-helpful team captain, Scott told everything she told him to everyone else, making him one of the most efficient boys to give advice to.

Over the first two weeks, everyone eagerly listened, always eating as much as they could, no longer caring about restraint or trying to make the calories "healthy".

Thanks to the witch accelerating muscle gains too, her advice bore physical evidence for everyone's already gullible, magically-influenced minds, and she ended up looking like a genius to them despite her misleading advice. Nobody actually looked too remarkably different yet, since it'd only been two weeks, but they were definitely showing better results in the gym... and just like she expected, all of them had started gaining.

It was usually about about a dozen pounds per human boy, but in some cases it was more exceptional. Delightfully, the powers the werewolves had seemed to make them better gainers, always well above the average. She had to admit, even though it was pretty easy for her magical senses to detect that there were werewolves, she wasn't originally sure if werewolves were going to be better or worse gainers than humans. It was predictable that they were good at gaining muscle, but the issue of fat and how fast their metabolisms might be had been more ambiguous.

Scott was actually a bit of an outlier even among the werewolves. He had already gained thirty pounds, even when weighed first thing in the morning, enough that his changes were already starting to get more noticeable.

His arms were already looking somewhat thicker and beefier, thanks to his werewolf abilities healing his workout strain better, which in turn made his muscles grow a bit better than just the witch's enchantment alone. And with the healing also giving him more energy and protecting him from most post-workout soreness, he was also more willing to go to the gym in the first place, helping him stay devoted. His belly had a permanent layer of new squishy softness over a tight, heavily swollen bulge containing the latest meals he'd pigged out on, and his thighs were a little beefier as well. Along with his thighs, his ass had grown pretty well, both with the fat covering it and the muscle beneath that, meaning that he'd already started to develop a respectable bubble butt. Plus, he wasn't sure, but he also thought his chest was already looking a little wider and more powerful, even if his pecs were getting a little softer. At 5'10 and about 185 empty, he was actually already a little overweight.

Not that he particularly minded. In fact, it actually felt good. He'd never been able to make such amazing progress before, and he loved all the carefree pigging out, and the lack of homework, deadlines, or anything terrible and dangerous going on.

As they were all going to bed one night, he noticed his sleeping clothes actually getting rather snug, even though they were loose and comfortable when he arrived... But he wasn't the only one who noticed, since Isaac came over to comment.

"Looks like you blew right through that 'twenty or twenty five pounds' you were talking about when you got here." Isaac innocently teased, poking Scott's belly in his tight grey t-shirt.

"Well, you grew too... looks really good on you, actually," Scott said. Isaac had grown by a solid twenty-two pounds, but he worked out the least out of all the werewolves, so it was mostly fat. His belly already looked nearly as big as Scott's, and his chest was a touch softer, but his arms hadn't really gotten much thicker, and his butt and thighs hadn't grown as much.

"...Looks good on you too..." Isaac said after a small pause, as he looked away for a moment with slight redness on his cheeks before turning back to Scott and speaking. "You should keep getting bigger, actually," Isaac said.

"Really?" Scott said.

"I mean, yeah! Think about it. This place feels really safe and fun, but if we're ever in danger again... you don't actually like fighting unless you have to, and you definitely don't want to kill anyone. But the bigger you are, the less anyone wants to mess with you, right?" Isaac said.

"He's got a point," Stiles chimed in. "I mean, True Alpha even sounds stronger than a regular Alpha, but you don't really look that tough at a glance. It makes perfect sense to bulk up some more and match that title outside of just personality. And this is your chance, since it looks like you're actually pretty damn great at gaining weight when you try, and this place has all the food you could ever want. You've literally gained three times more than me," Stiles concluded, since he was indeed only ten pounds heavier than he started. It was only even noticeable when his shirt was off, and it was just enough that his stomach still bulged slightly when empty, and his jeans gave him small lovehandles when he wore them.

"Even if you end up fat too, that could still be a good thing," Isaac said. "Werewolves don't have to worry about fat making them unhealthy, it'd just make you look bigger. Plus, since we're more durable, the fat could act like extra cushion if you get attacked. Not only that, but there are a bunch of football players and power-lifter guys who are pretty fat, so even from a human perspective it's not all that weird," Isaac explained. Part of him could hardly believe he was being bold enough to flat out say that Scott should not only bulk up, but still keep getting fatter. Still, since the magic had lowered his inhibitions a bit, it was possible.

"Yeah, you're right... I think I'll go ahead and work on seeing how huge and strong I can get, might as well. I'd just be miserable trying to control myself with unlimited delicious food here." Scott said.

Isaac found himself oddly thrilled by that declaration, but before he could even stop himself, he ended up blurting out something else in the heat of the moment...
131221.title: Scott, Stiles, and Isaac

1312211.content:
"I'll help!" Isaac blurted, his voice at an odd pitch before he quickly shut up, realizing he sounded far too eager.

"You will? Thanks, that sounds great! ...But how exactly were you planning on doing it? Do you like, know what food I should be eating and stuff like that?"

"Well, yeah, sorta... Plus I could like... Bring you food, and cheer you on... and feed it to you, and rub your belly to help make room?" Isaac said, even though he was feeling weirder about it by the moment.

"...R-rub my belly?" Scott said, blushing slightly. Something about the thought sounded oddly appealing to him, but he wasn't quite sure why.

"If it's weird, you don't have to-"

"No, no, those all sound like great ways to help! Thank you so much, Isaac!" Scott interrupted almost too quickly, as he stared straight up at Isaac.

Stiles simply sat struggling to keep himself from laughing as he listened to the conversation, mainly because it was so blatantly obvious that both of them were more into the whole situation than they were letting on.

But after that day, Isaac diligently kept up his end of the deal. He and Scott would not only spend lots of time in the cafeteria, but he'd also bring food back from the cafeteria whenever Scott was back at the cabin. He thoroughly encouraged Scott in the gym as well, even making his protein shakes and packing his protein bars for him. The camp had barely any real schedule structure at all, letting the boys make all of their decisions on their own. This only made it far easier for Scott and Isaac to fully focus on their new goal of bulking Scott up.

Scott expected that he might have to start dealing with negativity, especially because most of the weight was piling on as fat... But he was wrong. Everyone seemed fascinated by how much Scott was getting bigger and stronger, and the unbelievable amounts of food he could put away.

Two and a half weeks passed, making it just over a full month since they'd all first come to the camp. With Isaac's help, Scott gained an astonishing 50 more pounds, bringing him up to 235.

But fat wasn't the only thing being added. Scott literally got stronger by the day, and although his gains were still mostly fat, his arms had avoided enough fat gain that it was obvious he was putting on muscle too, even more so if he actually flexed. With both the witch's enchantments and his own werewolf powers in place, he'd already gained almost thirty pounds of muscle in one month, which was utterly astounding.

Still, Scott's belly had developed a hefty layer of jiggly fat, and it was surprisingly soft, being mostly subcutaneous fat. In fact, he was actually developing an overhang instead, paired with steadily developing rolls and soft lovehandles instead of a slim, tapering waist. His thighs rubbed together, and his ass was fatter and bouncier than ever. The fat and muscle combo made both his arms and legs look handsomely thick and meaty. His shoulders were wider too, and his pecs were big, but definitely softened by fat, to the point they were starting to get a bit jiggly. Meanwhile, only a bit of fat had even affected his face at all, making it look just the slightest bit softer but not by much.

Scott's growth was especially obvious because the only new clothes anyone had access to were clingy jean shorts, equally clingy spandex shorts, and "Camp XXXL" t-shirts that seemed to naturally fit a bit snug.

But Scott was far from the only one growing impressively.

The average gains were up to eight pounds a week instead of six... Which was enough to start making a noticeable difference.

Even though Isaac was focused on getting Scott bigger, even he saw a bit of a gaining speed increase, having gained 29 pounds while still hardly working out, meaning it was almost all fat. At 6'2, he'd reached 216 pounds.... but being four inches taller than Scott, and having less underlying muscle to thicken and broaden his frame, the weight difference between them seemed like a lot more than nineteen pounds.

Isaac's fat was particularly loose and jiggly, and he'd developed a very flabby little gut that was already making a slight overhang and creasing in the middle a little. His ass and thighs weren't nearly as impressive compared to some others, especially not Scott's, but they'd definitely grown too. He was getting quite the flabby pair of manboobs as well, although they weren't too big just yet, and his arms were getting soft and plush with nothing but fat.

As Scott's best friend, Stiles had started gaining faster too, while also not exercising much just like Isaac. As was the average for human boys, he'd put on twenty more pounds, enough to become overweight and enough to start looking it too. The outline of his starter gut was always visible under his shirt, and he'd become a little softer all over.

As for other werewolves, Liam, Ethan, and Aiden had all become inspired by Scott's gain and hard work in the gym too. Liam had gained another 35 pounds, up from 25 in his first week. It wasn't that much faster than Isaac on paper, but considering he was a good seven inches shorter than Isaac, and he'd actually been working out? It was definitely impressive, and it looked like a lot more on his frame. Meanwhile, the twins had also worked out and still gained 40 pounds each, way up from only 20 each the first week, thanks to being able to help each other eat and exercise... Plus, Ethan had Danny's support too, and Danny was getting chunky himself.

One night, after a long day of gorging, Scott was sprawled out on his bed in exhaustion, letting Isaac rub his huge, protruding, heavily stuffed gut... After all, exercising but still gaining about three pounds a day required a ludicrous amount of food. Just looking at his belly jutting up in front of him like a mountain, packed with rich comfort food and loads of greasy meat, Scott felt like it should've hurt... But it actually didn't, thanks to his werewolf healing and durability. It just felt incredibly tight and heavy, but also very warm and almost relaxing. It'd been hours since his last gym visit, but he'd eaten so much it was like another workout, leaving him still a bit sweaty. Scott figured the steady warmth was from more blood and metabolic effort being directed to his stomach and digestive system to properly handle the sheer amount of food.

Isaac looked out the window as he rhythmically rubbed Scott's gut, and Scott belched powerfully every now and then, mind drifting off as he just enjoyed Isaac's touch... But something about the sky got Isaac's attention.

"Scott, the moon!" Isaac said suddenly.

"...What about it?" Scott said sleepily. "I feel like I swallowed it whole right now.... Uuurrrrrppp..."

"No, I mean, it's full! And I just remembered it was full the first night we were here too!"

"It's always been either full or a waning gibbous the whole time we've been here..." Stiles pointed out from his own bed. Having a werewolf best friend meant he knew quite a bit about moon phases "But every time a week passes, it somehow becomes full again"

"Why didn't you say you noticed sooner?"

"I figured if it wasn't doing anything bad, I didn't need to," Stiles said with a shrug. "Everyone seems so happy lately, and this place is great. Why get worked up over the moon acting weird here?"

"You're right... I feel so relaxed here, and no one makes us do anything... And I know we all eat like pigs lately, and we're getting fat, but it feels so amazing I'm starting to forget why it was ever a bad thing." Isaac responded.

"Plus, it might actually be a good thing. I mean, look how fast Scott's been growing, and how much he can eat. Isn't it amazing?" Stiles pointed out.

"Y-yeah... it really is..." Isaac said, glancing at Scott and immediately seeing how handsome he was, even sleepily sprawled out in bed. "I guess you're right. It's nothing to worry about, and it's probably good for us anyway." Isaac said, relaxing.

That was that, thanks to everyone's suspicions being inhibited.

Meanwhile, the witch was in her own cabin, and she could hardly believe her luck. Not only were the werewolves better gainers, but people were already fully giving in and admitting they liked gaining!

Still, she noticed that she'd happened to make the time loop start right on the day of a full moon too, and she pondered how it would be affecting the werewolves in camp in the future, since they didn't loop with the moon like those in the outside world. Already, it'd probably been having at least some effect, but she knew it'd been long enough that it'd kick in a lot harder for them very soon. She knew it wouldn't necessarily be just like a super moon, which delivered more power all at once. It would just be delivering the usual amount of power at once but far more frequently, which could potentially have a completely different effect.

At that point, the witch could've been thinking one out of a few different things:

It could be that the weekly full moon would act like an upgrade to the werewolves. Their muscle gain and stamina would see benefits, their powers would work better, they'd have bigger appetites, better digestion, and they'd be even more resistant to negative weight gain effects. Some of them could even get taller, and they'd all get better at handling and controlling the lunar energy after so much more exposure. Perhaps they might even develop brand new powers, depending on the wolf...

Or it would work more like an overdose, putting more continuous stress on the bodies of werewolves and actually make them lazier and weaker, with all the extra lunar energy also lowering their calorie requirements. But if they didn't want to exercise anymore, they'd probably spend more time eating instead... (This can also be optionally used to switch to pure fat gain rather than fat/muscle gain)

Or maybe she was thinking of something completely different...

So, which one was it?
1312211.title: Says he'll help Scott gain

choices: Focus on Jackson's search for answers
Focus on the twins, exploring their restored Alpha status
Keep focusing on Scott as he seeks Derek out.
13122111.content:
As it turned out, the unnaturally common full moon would most likely be upgrading the werewolf boys...

And as another week passed, and the effects finally started hitting harder, people started realizing it was true.

Scott was practicing lacrosse with Jackson, Danny, Liam, and the twins. A lot of players had pretty much stopped practicing, preferring to eat and relax more. Scott didn't really think it was worthy of blame or criticism though. Even he was only practicing when he wanted to. The only reason he could even practice that much was that he was resistant to post-stuffing discomfort, and even then it was awkward to try and maneuver with such a full gut to lug around.

After all, he'd reached 255, already a full 100 pounds heavier than he started... Technically more, if you included his stomach contents.

The practice was pretty intense for a short while, but then Aiden suddenly paused, not sweating or breathing hard but simply looking like he'd lost interest.

"Alright, I'm done for now... Gonna go get more food," Aiden said, slapping a hand to his rather impressive gut, which strained his uniform and made it ride up a bit.

"There's no way you're actually hungry..." Jackson said in minor irritation, looking at how obviously bloated and overfed Aiden was. His gut was totally round and quite firm, but there was still a jiggly little patch of softer fat padding the underside of his stomach, and it wobbled slightly when his palm struck his stomach.

"I'm not, but I still really want some rare steak right now. And it's unlimited free food, might as well eat as much as you want, right?" Aiden responded, not the least bit ashamed. Liam seemed like he was going to agree, but Jackson spoke first.

"Hell no. You don't see me making some hog of myself," Jackson said with a grimace, half-right and half-wrong about the hog bit. In comparison to other werewolves, he'd definitely gained the least, even being out-gained by some of the human boys... But he was still 30 pounds heavier than he started, and gaining a little under a pound a day even while still exercising was definitely not restrained eating.

"I think you're just jealous 'cause of this," Aiden said with a smirk, as he flexed a bicep. Sure enough, there really was a huge, impressive muscle there, since Aiden had already been pretty buff... And although gaining muscle was supposed to get much slower as you went, that didn't seem to matter in Camp XXXL, so both he and Ethan had added about 30 pounds of muscle each since first arriving, along with about 55 pounds of fat each.

Having gained the same amount of weight in solely muscle that Jackson had gained in total, and having already been somewhat beefier than Jackson when he started, the fat didn't hide that Aiden's biceps had gotten huge... and Jackson couldn't hide that he actually was sort of jealous. Unfortunately for him, muscle could be gained so much faster in Camp XXXL that controlling his eating a bit more than the others also hampered the speed of his muscle growth, leaving him only about eight pounds more muscular than when he started.

With no good comeback after getting his ego wounded, Jackson's eyes briefly went piercing blue, and his wolf fangs came in as he gave Aiden a snarl warning him to not rub it in any further...

Only for Aiden to respond with his own snarl, which looked and sounded much more threatening... and most surprisingly, came with the addition of bright red eyes. Jackson not only immediately shut up, but took a couple of steps back, eyes wide with shock and a bit of fear.

"But I thought you weren't- You aren't supposed to be-" Jackson started, grasping for the right words.

"...Aren't supposed to be what?" Aiden said confusedly, as his face went back to normal.

"You had Alpha eyes! How'd you do that?! You didn't kill anyone, and only Scott is supposed to be a True Alpha!"

Aiden seemed surprised, before briefly turning to look at Ethan. Already knowing what he wanted to see, Ethan flashed him his werewolf eyes, and Aiden flashed his at the same time... Sure enough, both of them had bright red eyes again.

"Woah." Aiden said simply.

"How the hell did it come back?!" Ethan asked excitedly.

"Fuck if I know," Aiden replied with a shrug. "Just more proof this place is awesome... anyway, wanna go get that steak now?"

"Yeah, could use that extra fuel for this Alpha power," Ethan replied, before motioning to Danny to join them as well, with a smug grin. Danny gladly jogged over to his side, looking strong and chunky as well. With Ethan's help, he was one of, if not the best human gainer, and he'd packed on a total of 55 pounds since starting. He gave Ethan's round, wobbly, well-fattened ass a good slap and a squeeze, and Ethan responded by kissing him passionately, not caring in the slightest who saw. Once Ethan and Danny were done, the three left.

Although the others were pretty much completely used to the PDA, they were still in total shock over the returning Alpha status, and Scott quickly left the lacrosse practice to go find Stiles and Isaac, who were among those who'd stopped practicing, at most just coming to watch sometimes. Liam quickly tagged along, knowing Scott had a way of getting to the bottom of things.

Scott was already starting to think that there was a good chance the unusual moon cycles were what restored Alpha status to the twins, but he needed other opinions on the matter. They could find Derek too, maybe he knew a bit more about what was happening as an actual employee... although even he seemed to be able to mostly do what he wanted, and Scott still had no idea how exactly he got the job.

Meanwhile, Jackson stormed off, head swarming with thoughts. Why were Ethan and Aiden getting their Alpha status back? Was it because he used to be an Alpha, or was it just because of the camp's effects?

Thoughts of Aiden's huge biceps and commanding red eyes filled Jackson's head, causing him to grit his teeth and threatening to make him bring out his claws and fangs. What gave Aiden the right to be so much stronger than him?! They both exercised, the main difference was that Aiden and his meathead of a brother just ate like fatass hogs. It wasn't fair!

Still, despite his anger, Jackson kept coming back to a specific question, more important than anything else... If it was merely the camp's effects that made it happen... could he become an Alpha without killing too?

Where will the focus be now?
13122111.title: Upgrade

choices: Teaches Scott how to use his powers to eat more.
Tells Scott to use his growing power to find a new way to increase appetite.
Neither, but then Stiles asks for help gaining faster.
131221113.content:
It wasn't particularly hard for Scott to find Isaac, Stiles, or Derek. Isaac was taking a nap, while Stiles and Derek were in the cafeteria, each drinking huge milkshakes and apparently already talking about something before Scott came in with Isaac and Liam.

As soon as Scott saw Derek, he was blown away by how much fatter Derek was than when they all first came. He was probably the only one who'd gained more than Scott overall, and it showed. He didn't seem like he'd already gained /that/ much more, probably just about 25 or 30 pounds compared to Scott, but it was still startling.

Proportionately, more fat seemed to go to Derek's belly than it did for Scott, creating a considerable overhang at the cost of a slightly smaller proportion everywhere else, but there was still so much weight that his thighs and ass were about as thick as Scott's, and his arms were huge with both fat and muscle, seeming to be a bit bigger than Scott's and packed with fantastic strength. His face was fatter too, already sporting some roundness and a double chin, although he still looked incredibly handsome. Plus, he was still just overall wider and thicker than Scott. His clothes were a terrible fit too, but he didn't even seem to care.

Scott was at a loss for words, having trouble understanding just how Derek was so big. Scott had Isaac's help, but Scott hadn't seen anyone helping Derek gain.

"Derek? How'd you get so big already?!" Scott asked, momentarily forgetting his original concerns. "Weren't you still thin when we got here?"

"I just keep eating, that's all." Derek said casually, patting his huge, partially exposed gut and making it wobble a little.

"But what about getting full?!"

"Something about this place makes it a lot harder to get full...and I think it hit me especially hard. At first I hoped I'd be more resistant, but whatever's going on here actually seems to cooperate with our powers and our strengths instead, so us being stronger just makes it work better. I have the most experience being a werewolf, I've had to regenerate from a ton of things, and I can become an actual wolf, so my body is especially used to handling huge changes. With all that in play, I'm giving the magic a lot to work with. Of course, this is all just my theory... but besides that, I really can't explain why I'm getting bigger so easily, even if I did stop fighting it pretty quickly."

"Well, it is a pretty good theory..." Scott started, before Liam suddenly elbowed him in his stomach... which wasn't that painful, but was enough force to cause a quick belch from Scott.

"That's not what we're really here for. We're here because Ethan and Aiden both got their Alpha powers back, somehow, and we were hoping you knew something," Liam said.

"Oh, you mean like this?" Derek said, before flashing everyone his fangs and blood red wolf eyes, startling all of them. Derek simply chuckled at the response before reverting his face back.

"You too?! And you didn't say anything?!" Stiles said incredulously.

"I didn't want anyone getting too worked up or suspicious about it, especially considering what you normally have to do to be an Alpha. But now that I know it's happened to others too, I'm not too worried."

"...Okay, I guess that makes more sense. Plus, you've always been kinda crappy at communicating anyway..." Stiles said.

"I can communicate just fine!" Derek said, glaring at Stiles.

"I don't see anyone vouching for you," Stiles said with a shrug, as he sipped his chocolate milkshake. Derek just silently mouthed a couple of swears.

"Still, do you know anything about why this is happening, Derek?" Isaac asked.

"This kind of situation barely happens, especially not with the actual moon... but I have heard stories and legends about spells or potions that replicate the effect of being under a full moon unusually often... As long as the magic is done right, the effect is usually like a werewolf supercharge. Your body not only gets saturated with lunar energy, but since its long term, you can get much better at manipulating that lunar energy and your body's own processes. Unfortunately, it always takes at least a few weeks to fully kick in, even longer to fully train your upgraded body, and all of the magic can be difficult and tedious, or just plain impossible under most circumstances. That's why you barely hear about it even though there are plenty of power-hungry werewolves."

"But most importantly, we have nothing to worry about, right?" Scott asked, feeling rather defensive of his happy, comfy, danger-free life.

"I don't think so. Like I said, the effects are always positive as long as the magic is done right." Derek said.

Satisfied with knowing that they could mostly just continue on like before, everyone decided to sit down for a hefty meal, since they were already in the cafeteria anyway.

It also turned out to be a great way to see how Derek could eat up close, filling Scott with both awe and a bit of envy.

He could eat significantly faster than Scott usually did, and he'd gotten to the point where he didn't even ask for just plates anymore... He would have a whole cart of food filled up just for him, and then bring it to the table.

Lasagna, creamy mashed potatoes, meatloaf, pizza, steak, pulled pork sandwiches, buttered rolls, bratwurst, fried chicken... All of it disappeared into Derek's mouth with breakneck speed. His powerful jaws and throat could both chew faster and swallow bigger pieces at once, and the others swore even his cheeks had gotten more flexible, all the better to let him cram more food in.

Scott tried to keep up with him, eyes wordlessly challenging him, and Derek seemed to silently accept the challenge as they each raced through their own cart of food. But still, although Scott had surges of speed and determination where he seemed to hold his own very well, he just couldn't keep up overall.

After perhaps an hour, Scott looked ready to explode, periodically belching and resting his hands on top of his completely stuffed, pulsing tummy. The familiar feeling of unusual warmth quickly arrived, and he let out a moan, reclining back in his seat a little. His shirt had food stains all over it, his face still had traces of crumbs and sauce, and Isaac was steadily massaging his belly to help him out, while Liam just stared transfixed, and moderately stuffed after quite an impressive feast of his own. Stiles had eaten a lot as well, but still the least, and he seemed to be at a total loss on which over-bloated, totally spherical gut he should ogle more between Scott's or Derek's.

"Damn... how do you... Uuurrrrrrpppp... do it?" Scott asked Derek through labored breaths. Derek seemed much more comfortable, and he was actually still finishing up, boasting more empty plates than Scott.

"Well, to be honest..." Derek started.
131221113.title: Keep focusing on Scott as he seeks Derek out.

1312211131.content:
"There is a way to use our enhanced powers to eat more... But it's about strength and skill, not just effort, so don't be surprised if you don't get it right away," Derek said.

"What is it?" Scott asked, leaning in closer.

"I've tried controlling my regeneration and body processes to will myself to digest faster, or will my stomach to stretch, but both of those things are complicated enough that I couldn't make a big difference... But now I've found a compromise..." Derek said.

The others just stared impatiently, waiting for him to go on.

"Basically, speeding up digestion is hard... It requires a lot of things breaking down really rapidly, getting absorbed properly, and you can only make certain enzymes work so fast. But there are two options that are a lot more doable... One is that you use the power of your stomach muscles to compress your food as tight as you can. The problem there is that there's a lot of water and fluid in your stomach, making it hard to compress it too much. Luckily... Making yourself absorb extra water and fluids faster is more doable. And when you absorb the extra water from the compressed food, it gets easier to pack it all in tighter."

"Teach me!" Scott said immediately, completely taken in by how promising it all sounded.

"Me too!" Liam chimed in.

"Alright, but you have to do what I say, no whining and getting frustrated if anything goes wrong. I said it was doable, but I never said it was easy. Got it?"

"Got it," both Scott and Liam said.

"Good... now, just close your eyes and have all the muscle in your abdominal area squeeze in as tight as it can. Keep the pressure even, and imagine it pressing it on all sides, and imagine it getting tighter and tighter. If you focus hard enough, you can actually make it happen.

Scott and Liam obeyed, wincing a bit at their first attempts... But sure enough, their stomachs noticeably got a little smaller and more tightly packed, and they both started to belch repeatedly, squirming in mild discomfort.

"Keep going. Squeeze hard, and get all the gas out. It might make you nauseous, but just focus on adding more pressure, and ignore the discomfort." Derek instructed.

Isaac and Stiles just watched a bit worriedly as Scott and Liam continued, panting and belching and sweating a bit as they applied enormous amounts of pressure to the food in their guts, almost feeling like they were going to make themselves burst.

"Now, imagine your body drawing in water, imagine your cells bloating up with it. Think about how much you want to relieve the pressure. It's kind of like healing. Make your body do what it has to to relieve the pain and pressure."

Scott and Liam obeyed, after some struggle. There was the strange sensation of their bodies feeling a bit more bloated and waterlogged overall, and not just in their stomachs, as fluids were drawn out of their stomachs and into their bloodstreams and other tissues with incredible speed, especially whenever they managed to push any fluid into the small intestine, where it was easiest to absorb.

It took several arduous minutes, but the others could actually see both Scott and Liam slowly shrink their stomachs.

By time they were done, they still looked obviously full, other parts of their bodies had gotten a little puffier looking, and they were sore and completely exhausted, but their stomachs had gone down considerably in diameter.

"That was actually a lot better than I expected for it being the first time either of you tried it... It must be because of all the magic and unique conditions going on here." Derek said. "Nice work. But still, you're going to have to practice that multiple times a day if you want it to get any easier or more efficient."

Both Scott and Liam groaned, feeling like their stomachs were full of lead even though they'd gotten smaller in diameter, since they'd packed the food so much denser.

"Don't worry. It hurts now, but it should still be pretty easy to use the bathroom, since all that water didn't actually leave your system. Your body will be able to guide it back to where it's needed." Derek said.

Scott and Liam panted out their words of thanks in spite of the discomfort they were in, since they were the ones who wanted the secret, after all.

The others had to help them up, but nonetheless, they kept practicing diligently over the next two weeks, spending significantly more time together to help and motivate one another. Isaac was free to learn too, but he didn't seem as interested, not wanting to have to strain himself so much just to get bigger. He was mostly just there to keep providing the gluttonous wolves with more food, and help them push their limits.

But every day, the process got a little easier and less painful, and they were able to complete the process more quickly too. Scott tended to be a little better at it than Liam, but Liam was never far behind. They could pack in far more food than before, making their weights experience a surge in progress as well...

But just how effective is the new technique really? How many pounds did they gain in two weeks?
1312211131.title: Teaches Scott how to use his powers to eat more.

1313.content: What about a summer camp that due to the supernatural activity gets a weight gain curse placed upon the land when people arrive
1313.title: Other (specify)

1351.content:
In this world, werewolves lived alongside humans.
At first there were some issues, mostly for the younger wolves who were learning control and use their powers.
So that’s why in most countries children were separated until high school where they shared some classes. Well, of course there were still some classes for werewolves and classes for humans. Especially P.E and sport teams.
Werewolves, even bitten ones, are of course stonger, but also way taller. For example when Stiles’s best friend, Scott, got bitten, he put on 7 inches in a week. There were no male werewolves under 6’4”. So humans could not rival them at lacrosse or any other sports. Stiles could not imagine being tackled by his best friend. His 147 pounds body would be literally crushed.

A deal made with the werewolves was not to bite humans. Of course there were exceptions. Scott was one with his severe case of asthma. In exchange, werewolves had a particular stature in society: one county, one pack. In Beacon Hills county the Hales were the werewolves. They were really present in the organisation of the town even if key jobs such as the Sheriff or the mayor’s office were occupied by humans.
That’s how Stiles knew the Hales. His dad was the Sheriff and worked closely with Talia Hale, the Judge.

The greatness of werewolves was also celebrated with many town gatherings where humans mostly provided food for the wolves. It was tradition. The wolves could eat a huge amount of food. And it showed. Stiles studied werewolf biology in middle school and learned that male werewolves’ bodies easily stocked calories. That’s why most of the male werewolves were big. It didn’t change their capacities, reflexes or health, but they were just fat.

In the case of Scott, a few weeks after the bite and his growth spurt, Stiles noticed he was gaining weight. He remembered poking at his little belly. Scott told him it was something his wolf liked and that his appetite was basically bottomless. Now Scott was pushing 350, one of the biggest wolves of the school. He was also mostly with his pack. He took some time for Stiles but less than before.

Stiles was not really a big fan of his new pack mates. First there was Isaac Lahey. Another bitten wolf and maybe the smallest. Well if you consider being 6’6 for 280lbs small. He was beautiful but he had the nasty habit of stealing Scott from Stiles. Plus he was a bit arrogant. Well all werewolves are, and he was certainly much less arrogant than Jackson Whittemore. Urgh.. that one was an idiot. Born with a silver spoon, or many, in his mouth, he was walking as if he owned their poor human lives. He was also a bit of a bully with Stiles, even if he stopped, thanks to Scott.

But the one Stiles swore he’d never like was Derek freaking Hale. If Jackson was acting like a spoiled prince, Derek Hales was the freaking Queen of Sheba. Well granted the city belonged to his family. Granted he was the heir of the Hale pack. Granted he was the biggest man Stiles had ever seen (almost 7 feet and an astonishing 400lbs). That was not an excuse to act like that.

“Stiles” called his gentle giant puppy, pulling him in a McCall signature bear hug. He took a deep breath of Stiles’ hair. That was a common thing. Mostly every morning actually. A wolf thing that Stiles accepted. “Got my morning treat?”

Stiles rolled his eyes. “As if I could forget. Just once I forgot it and I had to suffer with your pouting face all day.” He answered pulling out a box of donuts for Scott. It was customary for humans to give food to wolves to show their “gratitude”.

Scott was salivating. “You’re the best bro.” He said finishing in a bite the first donut. “I was so hungry.”

“Aren’t you always?” Stiles snickered while poking at Scott’s massive belly. He growled playfully at that.

“You like it bro.”

Before Stiles could answer, they were interrupted but the other three wolves. Stiles sighed at that. He knew that the wolves knew he was not a big fan of them. And now they were crowding him by his locker. Isaac was eyeing the half emptied box in Scott’s hands trying to pick one.

“Hey!” Stiles exclaimed. “Those are for Scott!”

“And what are you going to do Stilinski?” Whittemore sneered. “Fight us?”

That’s when he felt the bulk of Derek Hale on his side. “Calm down Jacks. Obviously Stiles has a favourite wolf.” At that Scott looked at him surprised.

“Shut up!” Stiles said as he tried to go past them. A bit difficult with these four huge bodies. “Lemme go.”

“Why don’t you bring me food?” Hale asked. “I’m going to be Alpha someday. Everybody gives me what I want.”

“That’s why I don’t. Scott is my best friend and he is nice to everybody. He doesn’t remind me how weak and pathetic I am because I’m human. He’s not arrogant. And he doesn’t walk around like he’s the freakin Queen of Sheba!” Stiles didn’t know what happened. He was yelling at a werewolf. Something you didn’t do. Because, hello they’re werewolves they could destroy you in less than a second. And knew everybody in the hall was looking at them. And looking at him with pity in their eyes.

“Excuse me?” Said Hale. His eyebrows were raised and Stiles understood he annoyed the wolf. He had to find a way out. “What did you just say?”

Then the bell rang to announce the beginning of first period. As the teachers entered the hall, he thanked all the gods for his luck. And he could be safe for at least three hours with his werewolves-free classes.
He was so infuriating.
1351.title: Werewolves are known

choices: ...someone else sat down at his table!
13511.content:
Stiles sighed heavily as he walked into the lunch room. Whereas his morning classes had all been werewolf-free, the rest of the day was decidedly not, and that started with lunch. And lunch meant seeing Scott...and dealing with the rest of his pack again.

In the lunchroom, there was a definite divide between werewolves and humans. Not that it was based on animosity, but it’s hard to focus on eating your lunch with a bunch of hungry behemoths looming over you. Scott and Stiles had been the singular exception to this rule. When Scott had been bitten, Stiles had been determined that their friendship wouldn’t change. And though becoming a werewolf meant that Scott now had to spend a lot of his time with the Hales and his new pack, Stiles wanted to make sure that he and Scott still had some bro-time. And that meant lunch together.

Standing in the lunch line, Stiles couldn’t help but rhuminate over the events of that morning. Being teased and tortured by Jackson and Isaac hadn’t been anything out of the ordinary. Even Derek had been his Usual smarmy self, though that was something of a newer development. Up until the last couple of months, Derek was aloof, like he was too good to talk to Stiles. It was a little crushing, but now Stiles would almost say he preferred it to the extra taunts and teases. Maybe that’s what had set him off? Or maybe it was something else. Whatever it was, that surge of anger...it had been a rush. Almost like something he couldn’t control, which was not a good thing to happen in front of a group of werewolves.

With that worrying thought, Stiles quickly paid for his lunch and made his way toward the table he and Scott had sort of claimed as theirs, Scott’s larger, reinforced chair next to Stiles’s regular-sized one. As Stiles had almost reached the table...
13511.title: Later at Lunch

13512.content:
Stiles was still infuriated. This morning he was hoping to have a calm perfectly plain day. But, of course, Hale and Co ruined his day.

It was two hours ago, and he was still mad. And right now his nerves would be even more crushed as Lydia Martin came to him during AP calculus.

“So I heard you signed your death warrant this morning.” She simply said.

“Hahaha!” Stiles answered. “Don’t start me on this. He so infuriating.”

“Well it’s a werewolf trait. Pretty common actually. Most people just accept and enjoy it. It’s tradition to wish to have strong packs.”

“Well I’m not most people” Stiles grumbled.

Lydia sighted and put her hand on his arm.

“Stiles” she said with that tone he hated. The kind of tone she used when she was giving true, excellent advices that made people question their sole existence. “You may not like them, but there are part of this city. Basically forever. So if you want to have a normal life here, you’ll have to be at least civil with them. Especially with Derek. He’ll be the Alpha after his mother. Or it’ll be a living hell for you. And also for our dad.” Stiles looked at her at that. He did not think of that. Lydia sensed that. “I don’t want to alarm you. But just think about that.” Stiles must have looked distressed because now Lydia Martin was looking comforting.

“Also, I know that the wolves don’t really appreciate that. I mean Isaac just need and want to be wanted and loved. Natural after his terrible childhood. Jackson... well he ma be all arrogant and Le of himself, but he is truly looking for being accepted. And Derek, he’d live like a failure to know that someone of his town doesn’t like him.”

She made it sounds like Stiles was at fault. As if the pack bad feelings were because of him. But no! Scott never had any problem with that. He would have told him otherwise. Stiles was pretty sure of it.

He had to much to think. He just grabbed his his bag and left the class. He ignored the teacher called his name.

When he arrived at his jeep, he felt his phone ringing. Glancing at it he saw it was Scott. He would have certainly smelled his distress. Great!
13512.title: During his class with Lydia

135121.content:
A knock on his window woke him up.

He felt asleep after explaining to a concerned sheriff that’s he felt a bit sick and preferred going back home instead of calling him. His dad didn’t press, even if he suspected it was not the entire reason.

Anyways, Stiles guessed it was Scott. Well usually Scott just opened the window and jumped on Stiles. But with the look on Scott face Stiles understood his friend was troubled.

“Hey buddy” he said casually.

“Why did you ignore me all afternoon Stiles?!” Shouted Scott. “We were worried sick about you! You know you can’t do that to me!” He said as pulling Stiles into a hug, sent marking him.

After a moment we’re both guys stayed still, Scott examined his friend. “Are you okay? Are you sick or in pain? I can help!”

“It’s okay Scott. It’s just... well it’s stupid” he sighted, sitting on his bed. Scott layed on his bed takin Stiles close to him. Well Scott always had the power to make Stiles feel better. He was currently enjoying Scott’s huge belly as a pillow.

“I won’t press if you don’t want to talk. But for me nothing you say is stupid.” Stiles melt at that. Scott was the most caring person of the world.

“I know... it’s just something Lydia said to me, that made me think a lot. I just needed to be alone I guess.”

“You know you can always come to me.” He said rubbing Stiles hair.

Stiles smiled at that, relaxed, then he felt asleep.

———————

When he woke twenty minutes later, he was alone in his bed.

Scott must have left for his pack. His stomach rumbled and evening decide it was time to eat something, as he skipped lunch.

When he arrived in the kitchen, he found Scott wolfing down on the pint of chocolate ice cream.

“Of course, you would have found it.” Stiles teased.

“I was hungry. I didn’t really ate at lunch. I was worried about you.”

“Dude... well then I should bring you to diner tonight then. If you’re still hungry after so much ice cream of course” Stiles proposed as he slapped Scott belly.

“Hey! Be gentle with it”.

Then Scott looked a bit embarrassed. “Well I have already made plans with the guys”, aka the Pack, “pizza night at Derek’s.”

There was a moment of heavy silence.

“That’s great” Stiles said smiling, even if he knew that he could not fool Scott.

“You know, they were worried about you too.”

Stiles sighted at that. “Well they have a funny way to show it.”

“Stiles...”

“No, really. Being shoved and practically bullied every day is something really normal.”

“Stiles...”

“Well yeah, because they think humans are only good enough to worship them and...”

Scott was grabbing him, clearly angry at him.

“Stop! Stop saying that. They are my pack, my family. I can’t let you insult them!”

“But they can?” Stiles looked at Scott in the eyes. “What happened to being bros?”

“You’re challenging them, for god sake! You only bring me food and de y them that. That annoys our wolves.”

“Well I’m sorry that wanting to be with my best friend annoys your wolves.” Stiles was stubborn. Very stubborn. He was sad about this situation but also determined to defend himself.

“Maybe you should leave.” Stiles said showing him the door.

“What?” Scott was mostly shocked about what his best friend was saying.

That’s when the Sheriff came home and met the two teenagers.

“Hey Scott. How are you?” The words were warm but the Sheriff could feel the tension between Stiles and Scott.

“He was leaving.” Stiles answered. He looked at his friend, defying.

Scott shook his head before leaving the room. “Goodby Sheriff.” Warmly tone. “Stiles.” Disappointed tone.

As his father looked at him wondering what happened between them, Stiles just shook his head before climbing the stairs to his room.

He just could think he screwed up. Massively.
135121.title: Later at home
